image.altText: Two groups of protesters being separated by police.

props.synopsis: Two Victoria Police officers were hospitalised after violent clashes, while protesters were also arrested following scuffles in Canberra.

title.children: Protesters clash at Commonwealth Bridge as anti-immigration rallies held across the country

image.altText: Woman with blonde hair smiling by the water with a long path ahead that has a pelican standing on it during sunset.

props.synopsis: A primary school teacher is getting her students involved in a volunteer-led bird count, to gather a snapshot of birds across the country.

title.children: Bird-lovers help count species across Australia in annual bird count

image.altText: A man with glasses wearing a navy suit stands behind a podium speaking seriously.

props.synopsis: It's been a year since Canberrans re-elected an ACT Labor government for a seventh consecutive term — but as budget pressures bite, analysts say Labor's stocks are suffering from brand fatigue.

title.children: ACT Labor's 'forever government' brand is growing tired

image.altText: Two soccer plays chase a ball.

props.synopsis: Just last year, the club won the league, and a former president was jailed for stealing $20k. Now they are going to fold.

title.children: Last year they won the comp, now this football club is folding

image.altText: a man pulls a snake from its tail

props.synopsis: A passenger in a car has the fright of his life when a tiger snake slithers across his feet during a drive on the NSW far south coast.

title.children: 'Hell of a fright': Snake slithers over man's foot on drive to the shops

image.altText: Bonnie Jantke looks down as she plays piano.

props.synopsis: Many people struggle to approach the subject of death with family, and what kind of care they want to receive in their final months or years.

title.children: The conversation families avoid, and why it matters when time runs out

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe previously pleaded guilty to stabbing his co-worker Tshewang Choden to death in the kitchen area of the National Zoo and Aquarium in Canberra, where they both worked, in 2023.

title.children: Man who murdered Canberra Zoo co-worker 'remains infatuated' with her

image.altText: Three prison officers in riot gear pin down a female detainee.

props.synopsis: The ACT Supreme Court has made public confronting video showing the moments leading up to a strip search that violated an Aboriginal woman’s human rights.

title.children: Video of events before improper strip search in Canberra's jail released

image.altText: David Littleproud press conference with National Party leadership - 2025-05-20 13:03:02

props.synopsis: Nationals leader David Littleproud says he has spoken with Barnaby Joyce after the former deputy prime minister left the door open to joining One Nation. Follow live.

title.children: Nationals leader confirms he's spoken with Barnaby Joyce

image.altText: A close up shot of a man in a suit and tie

props.synopsis: British police say they're probing claims that Prince Andrew asked an officer to dig up dirt for a smear campaign against his sexual assault accuser Virginia Giuffre.

title.children: Police probing claims Prince Andrew tried to smear accuser

props.synopsis: In-receivership hospital group Healthscope is taking radical steps to stay alive, converting to a charity and proposing to take 90 per cent of a benefit intended to reduce workers' taxable income.

title.children: Healthscope to become charity as it proposes taking employee tax benefits

image.altText: A black and white photo of a blonde teenager holding a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: The ABC has uncovered the case as part of an examination of Gold Coast Hospital and Health Service's treatment of mental health patients and their suicides.

title.children: 'Felt so sickened': Teen's final message to health service met with silence

image.altText: Hong Kong plane

props.synopsis: The flight arriving from Dubai was landing at Hong Kong International Airport when it skidded off the runway, leading to the deaths of two men in a vehicle on the ground, according to police.

title.children: Cargo plane slides off runway in Hong Kong, two people dead

image.altText: University students in a large crowd outside

props.synopsis: At least a dozen Australian universities are using AI to detect AI. But they're not always catching cheats. Instead, they're wrongly accusing students of academic misconduct.

title.children: Over a dozen universities are using AI to catch AI — and getting it wrong

image.altText: Protesters face off with police at a demonstration on a city street.

props.synopsis: Victoria's police minister has backed the police response to protests in Melbourne's CBD on Sunday, when demonstrators were hit with rubber bullets and pepper spray.

title.children: Police minister defends use of rubber bullets on Melbourne protesters

image.altText: Woman with brunette hair wears Team Australia yellow sports uniform, hugging man with backward cap, white shirt

props.synopsis: When Saya Sakakibara saw her brother nearly die in a BMX crash, fear took hold. It nearly broke the star siblings’ Olympic dream.

title.children: Zero to 55kph in two seconds — Saya admits she's terrified of her sport

image.altText: F1 teammates in the pit lane, celebrating the team winning the constructors' championship

props.synopsis: Formula 1 championship leader Oscar Piastri says McLaren does not need to prioritise one driver over the other, as four-time world champion Max Verstappen continues to narrow the deficit to both.

title.children: 'Too close' to prioritise McLaren drivers as Verstappen continues charge

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX has traded sideways despite miners and gold producers being sold off. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX flat as miners and gold stocks retreat

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Deep Yellow slumps on CEO retirement

image.altText: A person sits cross-legged with a book in their hands.

props.synopsis: The winner for the Top 100 Books has been announced. What do the votes behind it say about us?

title.children: The best book of the century? We received 287,990 answers

image.altText: A man in a burnt out forest

props.synopsis: Dry winter conditions have resulted in extra fuel reduction burns in regional Victoria ahead of the fire season. But some scientists are asking if fuel burns are the best way to reduce fire risk.

title.children: Scientists question use of burns to cut bushfire risk

image.altText: A woman standing behind train route lines.

props.synopsis: Over the past few years, daily commutes have changed with flexible work arrangements. Most OECD countries' commute times are about 30 minutes. So how does Australia compare?

title.children: Get to work in under 30 minutes? Experts say it will not get any faster

image.altText: A starry sky and a small meteor over a dark beach.

props.synopsis: This week is a great time to find somewhere dark and look up with the Orionid meteor shower gracing southern skies. Here's everything you need to know about this annual sky show.

title.children: New moon makes ideal conditions for this week's meteor shower

image.altText: A group of five young men dressed in early 2000s fashion – nu metal band Limp Bizkit – posing outside an awards ceremony.

props.synopsis: Fred Durst takes to social media to say he has shed "gallons of tears" since finding out about the death of his "truly wonderful" bandmate.

title.children: Limp Bizkit pays tribute to bassist Sam Rivers after death at 48

image.altText: A soccer player wearing yellow and green and pink shoes runs during a game

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr will return to the Matildas fold off the back of limited minutes at Chelsea, but coach Joe Montemurro is confident she will shine.

title.children: Why Matildas want Kerr to 'love her football' in international comeback

image.altText: Two men on a podium, wearing head coverings and caps, raise their fists.

props.synopsis: A year after Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto won the election, the families of Indonesians arrested in recent protests are expressing dissatisfaction with his leadership.

title.children: Indonesia's democracy under pressure as Prabowo marks one year in office

image.altText: A small bat is held with two hands with its wings spread apart.

props.synopsis: A Pilbara resident says an attempt to save a small bat stuck in her house has resulted in painful treatment for a deadly virus that can be passed onto humans.

title.children: Warning over deadly virus after bat bites Pilbara woman

image.altText: A young child stacks colourful Duplo blocks at a childcare centre. Other children stand next to them.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of children in a regional Victorian city are on childcare waitlists, but centres say they cannot open to full capacity as they struggle to find qualified staff.

title.children: New childcare centres imposing waitlists amid worker shortage

image.altText: A suburban street with trailers and caravans parked on the road.

props.synopsis: Queensland councils put forward a motion calling on the state government to implement strict laws on caravan street parking.

title.children: Council motion may force caravan owners to find new parking spots

image.altText: Steam rises from a chimney looming above an industrial site in a rural area.

props.synopsis: A deal between Mossman sugarcane growers and a mill 100 kilometres away has been deemed unviable, leaving farmers without a place to send their product after this season.

title.children: Far North Queensland cane growers in limbo as mill deal ends

image.altText: A man looks at crates of eggs. He has his hands in his pockets.

props.synopsis: The bird flu outbreak that saw millions of chickens culled and a national shortage of eggs has been declared eradicated, but scientists warn a much deadlier strain of avian influenza could arrive this spring.

title.children: Millions being spent as Australia prepares for deadly H5 strain of bird flu

image.altText: A man in a colourful shirt holds blocks against a yellow background.

props.synopsis: Brisbane's Melt Festival has rapidly expanded in the past decade, inviting numerous venues into the celebration of queer artistry.

title.children: Melt Festival performer wants you to 'embrace your bonus hole'

image.altText: A large tree that has fallen down.

props.synopsis: Wild weather hit the Kimberley over the weekend, with some residents witnessing hail falling on their lawns despite it being a 38-degree day.

title.children: Wild weather batters WA's far north with 'unusual' hailstorm

image.altText: England's Alice Capsey, Charlie Dean, Emma Lamb and Heather Knight celebrate defeating India.

props.synopsis: England secures its Women's World Cup semifinal spot with a tense four-run win over tournament co-host India at Indor's Holkar Stadium.

title.children: England beats India to join Australia in World Cup semifinals

image.altText: Two women walk through university grounds in graduation robes

props.synopsis: A 20 per cent reduction on HECS debt is a welcomed relief for some 3 million Australians with a student loan. But those who paid their HECS early or are yet to rack up a debt will miss out on the support.

title.children: 'Frustrating': Students struggle to plan finances amid HECS debt changes
